intro: Bartsia crenata, commonly known as the scalloped bartsia, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves with scalloped edges. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, clustered in whorls along the stem, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Bartsia crenata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and heathlands.
